column5: Anyone use em yet?  thinking about picking up a couple
Funny you ask. I was just talking to a bud who nailed the walleye yesterday with those new raps. He loved it. I didn't get which series he was using though. Working weed edges he said.
just checked the bps werbsite, a lot of them are available as back orders lol

I just ordered a bunch from Cabelas, 8 or 9 of them, in the shad and crank shapes. They also make them in minnow and countdown. Anyway, Cabelas had them all in stock, got my shipment in 1 week, great service again.  Haven't used them yet, but can't wait, sometime this week
Caught a few eyes trolling the shad rap version on the opener until it was donated to a submerged tree .  Can't say it outperformed traditional shad raps but certainly didn't underperform them.

This seems to be an exact copy of a lure Salmo introduced a few years ago called the Whacky.  Something about ..."sincerest form of flattery."  At any rate they are available from North Bay Outfitters.  http://www.northbayoutfitters.com/default.aspx?ctl=ctl_ec_categories&category_id=309  Cheers, Mark
will probably check out at sail when im ready to buy em,
don't know if anyone is following this but this bait produces me thinks.....6 guys 5 days on lake of the woods, 185 fish on day 1  http://scatterrap.cabelasevents.com/challenge/
Looks interesting. Anyone know of stores in the gta that have them in stock ?
Le Baron's has them encase anyone is looking. Only the smaller sizes though. 07 and down . Larger ones are sold out.
BPS has them  i caught a bass on my first cast with one
Well nobody buy this lure that's the ultimate curse! Lol
They look great, hoping to pick some up for this weekend!
oh crap, i guess i have to throw out the three i just bought.   lol
sail has em, bass pro is on backorder  was talking to one of dave mercers fishing partners today, he was saying they're the same rapala lure body, just changed the lip
